meanings.definition: Having a sharp inclination or slope.
meanings.sent1: The hill was very steep, making it hard to climb.
meanings.sent2: The steep mountain path required careful footing.
meanings.sent3: The steep slide at the playground was a thrilling ride for the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her learning curve was steep, but she quickly picked up the new skill.
meanings.sent5: The steep cliff overlooked the vast ocean, creating a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: To soak in water or other liquid.
meanings.sent1: She had to steep the tea leaves in hot water to make a delicious brew.
meanings.sent2: The fabric needs to steep in the dye for a vibrant color.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally left the clothes to steep in the washing machine for too long.
meanings.sent4: The chef decided to steep the herbs in the broth for added flavor.
meanings.sent5: The tea began to steep, releasing its fragrant aroma into the room.

meanings.definition: To saturate with a quality or influence.
meanings.sent1: The music festival atmosphere seemed to steep the crowd in excitement.
meanings.sent2: His words were meant to steep courage into the hearts of his listeners.
meanings.sent3: The scent of fresh flowers seemed to steep the room in a pleasant fragrance.
meanings.sent4: The artist wanted to steep his painting with emotions from his own experiences.
meanings.sent5: The warm sunlight began to steep the garden in a golden glow.
